<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### enum  {#abfea249cd51ba9478b1e85bbc3508418}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::coverage::MCDCRecord::CondState ">
<a href="#abfea249cd51ba9478b1e85bbc3508418">CondState</a> represents the evaluation of a condition in an executed test vector, which can be True or False.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="abfea249cd51ba9478b1e85bbc3508418a174b6fce191ea66ffb1e674418d159f1" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MCDC_DontCare">
 (= -1)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="abfea249cd51ba9478b1e85bbc3508418a653e0944fb44b406d675db307806460c" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MCDC_False">
 (= 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="abfea249cd51ba9478b1e85bbc3508418a3b7b1235ae7885e1f859b0abc9c11988" />
<EnumerationListItem name="MCDC_True">
 (= 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

A DontCare is used to mask an unevaluatable condition resulting from short-circuit behavior of logical operators in languages like C/C++. When comparing the evaluation of a condition across executed test vectors, comparisons against a DontCare are effectively ignored.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/include/llvm/profiledata/coverage/coveragemapping-h/#l00397">397</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/include/llvm/profiledata/coverage/coveragemapping-h">CoverageMapping.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

### getConditionIndependencePair() {#aab64795aa8d12329cc14234c8beb8f52}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="TVRowPair llvm::coverage::MCDCRecord::getConditionIndependencePair (unsigned Condition)"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the Independence Pair that covers the given condition.

Because condition IDs are not associated based on their position in the expression, accessing conditions in the <a href="#a59573d02b596b1d3f901d928fbab9a5f">TestVectors</a> requires a translation from a ordinal position to actual condition <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>. This is done via PosToID&#91;&#93;.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/include/llvm/profiledata/coverage/coveragemapping-h/#l00520">520</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/include/llvm/profiledata/coverage/coveragemapping-h">CoverageMapping.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getTVCondition() {#ade5fe90524781cadafbce7dd8eb6333c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="CondState llvm::coverage::MCDCRecord::getTVCondition (unsigned TestVectorIndex, unsigned Condition)"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the evaluation of a condition (indicated by Condition) in an executed test vector (indicated by TestVectorIndex), which will be True, False, or DontCare if the condition is unevaluatable.

Because condition IDs are not associated based on their position in the expression, accessing conditions in the <a href="#a59573d02b596b1d3f901d928fbab9a5f">TestVectors</a> requires a translation from a ordinal position to actual condition <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>. This is done via PosToID&#91;&#93;.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/include/llvm/profiledata/coverage/coveragemapping-h/#l00493">493</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/include/llvm/profiledata/coverage/coveragemapping-h">CoverageMapping.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getTVResult() {#af62264df3a68523fdffe1ed36264691d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="CondState llvm::coverage::MCDCRecord::getTVResult (unsigned TestVectorIndex)"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the Result evaluation for an executed test vector.

See MCDCRecordProcessor::RecordTestVector().

### isConditionIndependencePairCovered() {#ab2f0e76891363fdc4deea3c443e4fdbf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::coverage::MCDCRecord::isConditionIndependencePairCovered (unsigned Condition) const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Determine whether a given condition (indicated by Condition) is covered by an Independence Pair.

Because condition IDs are not associated based on their position in the expression, accessing conditions in the <a href="#a59573d02b596b1d3f901d928fbab9a5f">TestVectors</a> requires a translation from a ordinal position to actual condition <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>. This is done via PosToID&#91;&#93;.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/include/llvm/profiledata/coverage/coveragemapping-h/#l00508">508</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/include/llvm/profiledata/coverage/coveragemapping-h">CoverageMapping.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
